findings.title: Deposit() function do not record actual function caller.
findings.description: The Deposit() function does not record the actual caller of the function, which can lead to potential security issues.

findings.title: Blacklister Privilege Escalation
findings.description: The blacklister has the ability to blacklist addresses and the owner can change the blacklister, potentially leading to unauthorized access control.

findings.title: Admin Control Over Contract Pause/Unpause and Admin Role Assignment
findings.description: In Guarded and GuardedUpgradeable contracts, the admin has the ability to pause or unpause the contract, and the owner can grant the admin role.

findings.title: TokenRecover: Owner can withdraw ERC20 tokens.
findings.description: The owner has the privilege to withdraw ERC20 tokens in the TokenRecover contract.

findings.title: Owner Privileges: Fiber/FiberUpgradeable
findings.description: The owner has privileges to add or remove _verifiedSigners addresses and supported tokens in Fiber and FiberUpgradeable contracts.

findings.title: Owner Privileges: Minting and Burning Tokens
findings.description: In LToken, LtokenCapped, and LTokenUpgradeable contracts, the owner has the ability to mint and burn tokens. Additionally, minter addresses can mint tokens and burner addresses can burn tokens.

findings.title: TokenRecoverUpgradeable: Owner can withdraw ERC20 tokens and contract ETHs
findings.description: The owner has privileges to withdraw both ERC20 tokens and contract ETHs without any restrictions.
